For anyone to remove any stop-sale order placed on a product by the department, or any product upon which a stop-sale order has been placed.

Subsection.Text: If the department finds that a person has violated or is operating in violation of ss. 526.50–526.56 or the rules or orders adopted thereunder, the department may, by order:

Paragraph.Text: Issue a notice of noncompliance pursuant to s. 120.695;
Impose an administrative fine not to exceed $5,000 for each violation;
Direct that the person cease and desist specified activities;
Revoke or suspend a registration, or refuse to register a product; or
Place the registrant on probation for a period of time, subject to conditions as the department may specify.

Subsection.Text: The administrative proceedings seeking entry of an order imposing any of the penalties specified in subsection (2) are governed by chapter 120.

If a registrant is found to be in violation of ss. 526.50-526.56 and fails to pay a fine within 30 days after imposition of the fine, the department may suspend all registrations issued to the registrant by the department until the fine is paid.
All fines collected by the department under this section shall be deposited into the General Inspection Trust Fund.
